intro: Phlomoides oreophila, commonly known as the mountain phlomis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to purple. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its rugged appearance. Phlomoides oreophila is adapted to rocky and well-drained soils, thriving in high-altitude environments.
